MetaData.Topics: confsig-HL7 Orders&Observations WG and Health and Human Services-2.5.1-profile-accNE_accAL-Immediate

HL7v2xConformanceProfile.ImpNote: Note that this specification focuses on the Laboratory Information System message.

HL7v2xStaticDef.EventDesc: HL7 Version 2.5.1 Implementation Guide: Laboratory Results Interface for US Realm, Release 1

MetaData.Name: Laboratory Results Interface
MetaData.OrgName: HL7 Orders&Observations WG and Health and Human Services
MetaData.Topics: confsig-HL7 Orders&Observations WG and Health and Human Services-2.5.1-static-ORU-R01-null-ORU_R01-1 - draft 0.9-Informative-Sender

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: An occurrence of MSH.21 (Message Profile Identifier) SHALL be valued with 2.16.840.1.113883.9.20 (LRI_NG_RN_Profile) or three occurrences SHALL be valued with 2.16.840.1.113883.9.16 (LRI_Common_Component), 2.16.840.1.113883.9.13 (LRI_NG_Component) and 2.16.840.1.113883.9.15 (LRI_RN_Component) in any order.
MSH.1 (Field Separator) SHALL contain the constant value '|'.
MSH.2 (Encoding Characters) SHALL contain the constant value '^~\&' or the constant value '^~\&#'.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/X) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/X) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/X) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = R, MM = R, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(R/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
MSH.9 (Message Type) SHALL contain the constant value 'ORU^R01^ORU_R01'.
MSH.12.1 (Version ID) SHALL contain the constant value '2.5.1'.

Component.Name: Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..5 Restricted to 2.5.1 in this guide. Literal value: _2.5.1'

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
MSH.15 (Accept Acknowledgement Type) SHALL contain the constant value 'AL'.
MSH.16 (Application Acknowledgement Type) SHALL contain the constant value 'NE'.

Field.Name: Country Code
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Character Set
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Alternate Character Set Handling Scheme
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Component.Name: Namespace ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The coding system for this component is locally managed.
Component.Reference: LRI-EI.a-2: CE.2 (Namespace ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.Name: Universal ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: EI_GU.3 (Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO-compliant OID.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199. LRI-EI.a-2: CEI.32 (Namespace Universal ID) SHALL be valued with an ISO- compliant OID.

Component.Name: Universal ID Type

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: EI_GU.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.Reference: LRI-EI.a-1: CE.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value _ISO_.

Field.Name: Software Certified Version or Release Number

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If PID.5 (Patient Name) is unknown the second occurrence of PID.5 SHALL be valued and only PID.5.7 (Name Type Code) shall be valued with the constant value "U" (i.e., the second occurrence of PID.5 shall be value as |~^^^^^^U|.
PID.1 (Set ID - PID) SHALL be valued with the constant value '1'.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15 The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component must uniquely identify the associated object, i.e., any object with which the field is associated. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.

Component.Name: Check Digit Scheme
Component.ImpNote: Length 3..3 C(O/X) ISSUE: The table should be specified.

Component.Name: Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1.
Component.Reference: LRI-CX-1: The CX.4 (Assigning Authority) SHALL use the HD-NG datatype definition.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

SubComponent.Name: Universal ID Type
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/X) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

SubComponent.Name: Surname
SubComponent.ImpNote: ISSUE: Why was this data type listed as constained, no limitations were proposed. The ST data type is normally used for short text strings. No leading blanks (space characters) are permitted. Trailing blanks are permitted. In this Profile, the only allowed escape sequences are those allowed in HL7 Version 2.5.1, Chapter 2, Section 2.7.4 - Special Characters. These are the escape sequences for the message delimiters (i.e., |^&~\).

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.Name: Name Validity Range
Component.ImpNote: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5. See XPN-12 Effective Date and XPN-13 Expiration Date components.

Component.Name: Professional Suffix
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199. Suggest using values from HL7 table 360. ISSUE: Why use this if the degree is not supported?

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = RE, DD = RE, HH = O, MM = O, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) SHALL be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 LRI-CE-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CE.1 (Identifier), CE.2 (Text), and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 C(R/RE) It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, text can still be sent, in which case no coding system should be identified.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-2: If CE.1 (Identifier) is not valued, then CE.2 (Text) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 ISSUE: It should be conditional and the predicate is based on the presence of CE.4: LRI-CE-4: If CE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is valued, then CE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued. It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.
Component.Reference: LRI-CE-4: If CE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is valued, then CE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12 C(R/X) Lab to EHR Condition predicate: Required if an alternate identifier is provided in component 4.

Field.Name: Multiple Birth Indicator
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Patient Death Indicator
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Identity Unknown Indicator
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Patient Primary Care Provider Name & ID No.

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof
Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

Field.Name: Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Title
Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Code/Class
Next of Kin / Associated Parties Employee Number

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If one or more SPM segments are present for the same OBR and if OBR-8 (Observation End Date/Time) is present, OBR-8 (Observation End Date/Time) SHALL be equal to or before the latest SPM-17.2 (Range End Date/Time)

If one or more SPM segments are present for the same OBR, then the earliest SPM-17.1 (Range Start Date/Time) SHALL be equal to or before OBR-7 (Observation Date/Time) and OBR-7 (Observation Date/Time) SHALL be equal to or before the latest SPM-17.2 (Range End Date/Time).
The value of ORC.2 (Placer Order Number) SHALL be identical to the value of OBR.2 (Placer Order Number).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of ORC.3 (Filler Order Number) SHALL be identical to the value of OBR.3 (Filler Order Number).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Field.Name: Order Status
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Field.Name: Response Flag
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

Filler Order Number: Universal ID Type

Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of ORC.12 (Ordering Provider) SHALL be identical to the value of OBR.16 (Ordering Provider).

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15. The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component (component 9) must uniquely identify the associated person. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

SubComponent.Name: Surname
SubComponent.ImpNote: ISSUE: Why was this data type listed as constained, no limitations were proposed. The ST data type is normally used for short text strings. No leading blanks (space characters) are permitted. Trailing blanks are permitted. In this Profile, the only allowed escape sequences are those allowed in HL7 Version 2.5.1, Chapter 2, Section 2.7.4 - Special Characters. These are the escape sequences for the message delimiters (i.e., |^&~\).

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof
Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1. C(RE/X)
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-4: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.9 (Assigning Authority) MAY be valued.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

SubComponent.Name: Universal ID Type
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/O) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of ORC.31 (Parent Universal Service Identifier) SHALL be identical to the value of OBR.50 (Parent Universal Service Identifier).

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note: The identifier component is always required.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, the original text attribute is used to carry the text, not the text component.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12 C(R/X) Required if an alternate identifier is provided in component 4.

Component.Name: Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: ISSUE- It should be conditional - Required if a coding system is identified in component 3.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditiona l- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: For linking Parent/Child results OBR-50 (Parent Universal Service Identifier) in a child observation SHALL be valued with the parent OBR-4 (Universal Service Identifier).
For linking Parent/Child results OBR-29.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier) in a child observation SHALL be valued with the parent OBR-3 (Filler Order Number).
For linking Parent/Child results OBR-29.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) in a child observation SHALL be valued with the parent OBR-2 (Placer Order Number).
For linking Parent/Child results OBR-26.2 (Parent Observation Sub-identifier) of a child observation SHALL be valued with the parent OBX-4 (Observation Sub-ID).
For linking Parent/Child results OBR-26.1 (Parent Observation Identifier) of a child observation SHALL be valued with the parent OBX-3 (Observation Identifier).
The value of OBR.1 (Set ID - OBR) SHALL be valued sequentially starting with the value '1' within a given segment group.
The value of OBR.2 (Placer Order Number) SHALL be identical to the value of ORC.2 (Placer Order Number).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Name: Universal ID Type
Component.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of OBR.3 (Filler Order Number) SHALL be identical to the value of ORC.3 (Filler Order Number).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

Component.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note: The identifier component is always required.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, the original text attribute is used to carry the text, not the text component.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System

Component.Name: Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: ISSUE- It should be conditional - Required if a coding system is identified in component 3.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditiona l- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

Field.Name: Priority - OBR
Field.ImpNote: Max length actually varies depending on the max length of a code in the code set

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = C(R/X) If TS.3 (YYYY) is not valued 0000, DD = C(R/X) If TS.3 (YYYY) is not valued 0000, HH = C(RE/X) If TS.3 (YYYY) is not valued 0000, MM = C(RE/X) If TS.3 (YYYY) is not valued 0000, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O C(O/X) If TS.3 (YYYY) is not valued 0000, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
If present, OBR-8 (Observation End Date/Time) SHALL be equal or later than OBR-7 (Observation Date/Time).
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = R, DD = R, HH = RE, MM = RE, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If valued, OBR.11 (Specimen Action Code) SHALL be a value with A, G, L, or O.

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 LRI-CWE.a-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text), and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(RE/X) LRI-CWE.a-2: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is empty then CWE.2 (Text) SHALL NOT be valued.

Component.Name: Name of Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12, C(R/X) LRI-CWE.a-3: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is populated then CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20, C(RE/X) The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1. LRI-CWE.a-4: If CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is populated then CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(R/RE) LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued. LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: WARNING: the table should be specified for an ID type.

Component.Name: Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If OBR.11 (Specimen Action Code) is valued G

Component.Name: Parent Observation Identifier
Component.ImpNote: Identifier of the OBX-3 Observation ID of the parent result. Typically, this is used in microbiology results where the sensitivities are linked to the specific culture OBX where the organism was identified.

SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note: The identifier component is always required.

SubComponent.Name: Text
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, the original text attribute is used to carry the text, not the text component.

SubComponent.Name: Alternate Text
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

SubComponent.ImpNote: ISSUE- It should be conditional - Required if a coding system is identified in component 3.

SubComponent.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditiona l- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

SubComponent.Name: Original Text
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

SubComponent.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

Component.Name: Parent Observation Sub-identifier
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Identifier of the OBX-4 Observation Sub- ID associated with the OBX-3 Observation ID of the parent result. Typically, this is used in microbiology results where the sensitivities are linked to the specific culture OBX where the organism was identified. The combination of OBX-3 and OBX-4 must be unique within a particular OBR.

SubComponent.Name: Placer Order Number: Universal ID Type
Filler Order Number: Universal ID Type

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If CWE_CRE.1 (Identifier) or CWE_CRE.4 (Alternate Identifier) of at least one occurrence of OBR-49 is valued CC or BCC

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15. The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component (component 9) must uniquely identify the associated person. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

SubComponent.Name: Surname
SubComponent.ImpNote: ISSUE: Why was this data type listed as constained, no limitations were proposed. The ST data type is normally used for short text strings. No leading blanks (space characters) are permitted. Trailing blanks are permitted. In this Profile, the only allowed escape sequences are those allowed in HL7 Version 2.5.1, Chapter 2, Section 2.7.4 - Special Characters. These are the escape sequences for the message delimiters (i.e., |^&~\).

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof
Assigning Authority
Component.ImpNote: The Assigning Authority component is used to identify the system, application, organization, etc. that assigned the ID Number in component 1. C(RE/X)
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-4: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.9 (Assigning Authority) MAY be valued.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: if HD_NG.2 (Universal ID) is not valued
If HD_NG.1 (Namespace ID) is not valued

SubComponent.Name: Universal ID Type
SubComponent.ImpNote: Length 1..6. C(RE/O) Note: Conditions need to be negotiated by the trading partners

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If OBR.11 (Specimen Action Code) is valued G

Component.Name: Placer Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.b-1: The datatype EI-NG SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

SubComponent.Name: Universal ID Type
SubComponent.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.Name: Filler Assigned Identifier
Component.Reference: LRI-EIP.b-1: The datatype EI-NG SHALL be used for EIP.1 (Placer Assigned Identifier) and EIP.2 (Filler Assigned Identifier).

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If EI_NG.2 (Namespace ID) is not valued

SubComponent.Name: Universal ID Type
SubComponent.Reference: LRI-EI-2: EI.4 (Universal ID Type) SHALL contain the value "ISO".

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 LRI-CWE.a-1: If data is available for only one Coded Element then the triplet of CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text), and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) shall be valued in accordance with the rules given for CE.1, CE.2, and CE.3.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(RE/X) LRI-CWE.a-2: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is empty then CWE.2 (Text) SHALL NOT be valued.

Component.Name: Name of Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12, C(R/X) LRI-CWE.a-3: If CWE.1 (Identifier) is populated then CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20, C(RE/X) The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1. LRI-CWE.a-4: If CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is populated then CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(R/RE) LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued. LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: WARNING: the table should be specified for an ID type.

Component.Name: Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of OBR.50 (Parent Universal Service Identifier) SHALL be identical to the value of ORC.31 (Parent Universal Service Identifier).

Component.Name: Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.1 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 Note: The identifier component is always required.

Component.Name: Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that text be sent to accompany any identifier. When a coded value is not known, the original text attribute is used to carry the text, not the text component.

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20 The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1.

Component.Name: Alternate Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 It is strongly recommended that alternate text be sent to accompany any alternate identifier.

Component.Name: Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..12 C(R/X) Required if an alternate identifier is provided in component 4.

Component.Name: Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: ISSUE- It should be conditional - Required if a coding system is identified in component 3.

Component.Name: Alternate Coding System Version ID
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..10 ISSUE: It should be conditiona l- Required if an alternate coding system is identified in component 6. However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199 Original Text is used to convey the text that was the basis for coding.

SegGroup.Name: TIMING_QTY
SegGroup.ImpNote: Although Timing/Quantity may be necessary for orders, it's not necessary for result reporting.

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: The value of TQ1.1 (Set ID - TQ1) SHALL be valued sequentially starting with the value '1' within a given group.
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = RE, DD = RE, HH = RE, MM = RE, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile
Format : YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]]+/-ZZZZ WITH YYYY = R, MM = RE, DD = RE, HH = RE, MM = RE, SS[.S[S[S[S]]]] = O, +/-ZZZZ = C(RE/O) If TimeZone Offset Profile

Component.Name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If OBR.25 (Result Status) is valued A, C, F, P, or R

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If there are multiple OBX segments associated with the same OBR segment that have the same OBX-3 values for (OBX-3.1 + OBX-3.3) or (OBX-3.4 + OBX-3.6), a combination of (OBX-3.1 + OBX3.3) or (OBX-3.4 + OBX-3.6) and OBX-4 SHALL create a unique identification under a single OBR.
The value of OBX.1 (Set ID - OBX) SHALL be valued sequentially starting the value '1'.

Component.Name: Alternate Text

However, the particular coding system indicates versioning should be handled will be appropriate here. The length has been increased to handle longer versioning strings.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If there are multiple OBX segments associated with the same OBR segment that have the same OBX-3 values for (OBX-3.1 and OBX-3.3) or (OBX-3.4 and OBX-3.6).

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If OBX.5 (Observation Value) is CE (as indicated in OBX.2), then CE.1 (Identifier) and CE.3 (Name of Coding System) or CE. 4 (Alternate Identifier) and CE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.
The value of OBX-5 (Observation Value) SHALL NOT be truncated.
If CWE.3/CWE.6 is valued 'LN' then CWE.1/CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.
If CE.3/CE.6 is valued 'LN' then CE.1/CE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If OBX-2 (Value Type) is valued "NM" or "SN" and OBX-11 is not valued "X" or "N"

Component.Name: Organization Name
Component.Reference: LRI-XON.b-1: XON.1 (Organization Name) or XON.10 (Organization Identifier) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: (Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5.) Use XON-10 Organization Identifier.

Component.Name: Organization Identifier

Predicate.EnglishDescription: If XON_NG.1 (Organization Name) is not valued

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20. ISSUE: Select either XON.1 to XON.10 to simplify unnecessary complexity.

Component.Name: State or Province
Component.ImpNote: State Value Set The 2 letter (alpha) codes should be used here. ISSUE: Length should be constrained accordingly.

Component.Name: Zip or Postal Code
Component.ImpNote: In the US, the zip code takes the form 99999[-9999], while the Canadian postal code takes the form A9A9A9.

Component.Name: Address Validity Range
Component.ImpNote: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5. See XAD-13 Effective Date and XAD-14 Expiration Date components.

Component.Name: ID Number
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..15. The ID Number component combined with the Assigning Authority component (component 9) must uniquely identify the associated person. Note - despite the component being named _ID Number_ this component is an ST string data type, not numeric, so the component is not limited to just numbers.
Component.Reference: LRI-XCN-1: If XCN.1 (ID Number) is valued, XCN.13 (Identifier Type Code) SHALL be valued.

SubComponent.Name: Surname
SubComponent.ImpNote: ISSUE: Why was this data type listed as constained, no limitations were proposed. The ST data type is normally used for short text strings. No leading blanks (space characters) are permitted. Trailing blanks are permitted. In this Profile, the only allowed escape sequences are those allowed in HL7 Version 2.5.1, Chapter 2, Section 2.7.4 - Special Characters. These are the escape sequences for the message delimiters (i.e., |^&~\).

Component.Name: Alternate Identifier

ConformanceStatement.EnglishDescription: If CWE.6 (Name of AlternateCoding System) is valued "LN" then CWE.4 SHALL be a valid LOINC code identifier format.

Component.ImpNote: Length 1..20, C(RE/X) The alternate identifier (from the alternate coding system) should be the closest match for the identifier found in component 1. LRI-CWE.a-4: If CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) is populated then CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) SHALL be valued.

Component.Name: Original Text
Component.ImpNote: Length 1..199, C(R/RE) LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued. LRI-CWE.a-6: If CWE.1 (Identifier) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifier) are not populated, then CWE.9 (Original Text) SHALL be valued. LRI-CWE.a-7: If the triplets identified by elements CWE.1 (Identifier), CWE.2 (Text) and CWE.3 (Name of Coding System) and CWE.4 (Alternate Identifer), CWE.5 (Alternate Text), and CWE.6 (Name of Alternate Coding System) are not valued then CWE.9 (Original Text) sshall be valued.

Component.Name: Second Name of Alternate Coding System
Component.ImpNote: WARNING: the table should be specified for an ID type.

Component.Name: Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
Second Alternate Value Set Version ID

Field.Name: Effective Date of Reference Range Values
